name: places/ChIJHdmCrOpZwokRDftG_pUGqEg
formattedAddress: 820 Greenwich St 3rd floor, New York, NY 10014, USA
adrFormatAddress: 820 Greenwich St 3rd floor, New York, NY 10014, USA

originalText.text:
Stayed on Marriott points.  At check in, clerk said they would need a credit card for incidentals.  Next, the clerk gave me a paper card like a benefits voucher and said that I was getting "credits" each day of the stay for the restaurant ($35), bar ($35) and spa ($50).

As it turns out the hotel was actually charging me an additional destination fee of $35 each day and masking it as a benefit. Then, when I tried to take advantage of the "benefits" to by a glass of wine, one glass of basic red wine was $42!!!!  With the tip, it cost me more to have a glass of wine than it cost to have a fabulous dinner in Greenwich Village.  No mention of destination fee at check in...

Then in the room, there was a mini bar and we wanted to buy the room candle which in the room the menu said $50 , but on the folio receipt the cost was $80 plus an additional $16 admin fee and taxes...so I was charged nearly double what we read in the room.

In summary, would I stay here again...NO THANK YOU.  I'll spend my earned points somewhere else next time.  This place seems deceitful...  No mention of destination fee upon check in, inflated bar prices Rodney Strong $42 per glass ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚, and misleading in-room mini bar menu.

So, what did the front desk say when I complained?   The hotel responded "Thank you".

originalText.text: Great place!  Beautiful room on the 10th floor overlooking the ocean. Chill, vibey pool scene all day without being pretentious. Hung out there hours all 4 days. Little trouble checking in but the manager (Raymon? Raymond? sorry I didnâ€™t hear it clearly with the mask) was a total pro and completely took care of us. Definitely recommend!
